quote: Order your soul  reduce your wants  live in charity  associate in Christian community  obey the laws  trust in Providence.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Simplicity  clarity  singleness: these are the attributes that give our lives power and vividness and joy.
author: Richard Halloway

quote: To live content with small means  to seek elegance rather than luxury  and refinement rather than fashion  to be worthy  not respectable  and wealthy  not rich  to study hard  think quietly  talk gently  act frankly  to listen to the stars and birds  to babes and sages  with open heart  to bear on cheerfully  do all bravely  awaiting occasions  worry never  in a word to  like the spiritual  unbidden and unconscious  grow up through the common.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: The attributes of a great lady may still be found in the rule of the four S's: Sincerity  Simplicity  Sympathy  and Serenity.
author: Emily Post

quote: Manifest plainness  Embrace simplicity  Reduce selfishness  Have few desires.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Happiness comes of the capacity to feel deeply  to enjoy simply  to think freely  to risk life  to be needed.
author: Storm Jameson

quote: Fear less  hope more  eat less  chew more  whine less  breathe more  talk less  say more  love more  and all good things will be yours.
author: Swedish proverb

quote: Practice easing your way along. Don't get het up or in a dither. Do your best  take it as it comes. You can handle anything if you think you can. Just keep your cool and your sense of humor.
author: Smiley Blanton

quote: To live and let live  without clamor for distinction or recognition  to wait on divine Love  to write truth first on the tablet of one's own heart-this is the sanity and perfection of living  and my human ideal.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Do all the good you can  By all the means you can  In all the ways you can  In all the places you can  At all the times you can.
author: Anonymous

quote: Go placidly amid the noise and the haste  and remember what peace there may be in silence. As far as possible without surrender  be on good terms with all persons. Speak your truth quietly and clearly  and listen to others  even the dull and ignorant  they too have their story. . . . Be yourself. Especially do not feign affection. Neither be cynical about love  for in the face of all aridity and disenchantment it is as perennial as the grass. Take kindly the counsel of the years  gracefully surrendering the things of youth. Nurture strength of spirit to shield you in sudden misfortune. But do not distress yourself with imaginings. Many fears are born of fatigue and loneliness. Beyond a wholesome discipline  be gentle with yourself. You are a child of the universe no less than the trees and the stars  you have a right to be here. And whether or not it is clear to you  no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should. Therefore be at peace with God  whatever you conceive Him to be  and whatever your labours and aspirations  in the noisy confusion of life keep peace with your soul. With all its sham  drudgery and broken dreams  it is still a beautiful world.
author: Max Ehrmann

quote: Accept the pain  cherish the joys  resolve the regrets  then can come the best of benedictions-"If I had my life to live over  I'd do it all the same."
author: Joan Mcintosh

quote: The way of a superior man is threefold: Virtuous  he is free from anxieties  wise  he is free from perplexities  bold  he is free from fear.
author: Confucius

quote: The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is not easy to find happiness in ourselves  and it is not possible to find it elsewhere.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: Joy is the feeling of grinning on the inside.
author: Dr. Melba Colgrove

quote: It is those who have a deep and real inner life who are best able to deal with the irritating details of outer life.
author: Evelyn Underhill

quote: To live happily is an inward power of the soul.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly  eat slowly  and lie about your age.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Virtue  like a dowerless beauty  has more admirers than followers.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: We can build upon foundations anywhere  if they are well and truly laid.
author: Ivy Compton-Burnett

quote: Though language forms the preacher  'Tis "good works" make the man.
author: Eliza Cook

quote: All times are beautiful for those who maintain joy within them  but there is no happy or favorable time for those with disconsolate or orphaned souls.
author: Rosalia Castro

quote: When you're in your nineties and looking back  it's not going to be how much money you made or how many awards you've won. It's really what did you stand for. Did you make a positive difference for people?
author: Elizabeth Dole

quote: For attractive lips  speak words of kindness. For lovely eyes  seek out the good in people. For a slim figure  share your food with the hungry. For beautiful hair  let a child run his or her fingers through it once a day. For poise  walk with the knowledge you'll never walk alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: What you become is what counts.
author: Liz Smith

quote: If an Arab in the desert were suddenly to discover a spring in his tent  and so would always be able to have water in abundance  how fortunate he would consider himself  so too  when a man who ... is always turned toward the outside  thinking that his happiness lies outside him  finally turns inward and discovers that the source is within him.
author: Seren Kierkegaard

quote: Happiness is not in our circumstances  but in ourselves. It is not something we see  like a rainbow  or feel  like the heat of a fire. Happiness is something we are.
author: John B. Sheerin

quote: Seek not outside yourself  heaven is within.
author: Mary Lou Cook

quote: If we have not peace within ourselves  it is in vain to seek it from outward sources.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Most true happiness comes from one's inner life  from the disposition of the mind and soul. Admittedly  a good inner life is difficult to achieve  especially in these trying times. It takes reflection and contemplation and self-discipline.
author: W. L. Shirer

quote: It's what you do that makes your soul  not the other way around.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: The happiest people seem to be those who have no particular cause for being happy except that they are so.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: I think the inner person is the most important. ... I would like to see an invention that keeps the mind alert. That's what is important.
author: Julia Child

quote: I don't think that... one gets a flash of happiness once  and never again  it is there within you  and it will come as certainly as death.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: There is no other solution to man's progress but the day's honest work  the day's honest decisions  the day's generous utterances  and the day's good deed.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: You have much more power when you are working for the right thing than when you are working for the wrong thing.
author: Peace Pilgrim

quote: I am convinced that we must train not only the head  but the heart and hand as well.
author: Madame Chiang Kai-Shek

quote: Live virtuously  and you cannot die too soon  or live too long.
author: Lady R. Russell

quote: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: People see God every day  they just don't recognize Him.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: We hear voices in solitude  we never hear in the hurry and turmoil of life  we receive counsels and comforts we get under no other condition.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: Happiness is not a possession to be prized  it is a quality of thought  a state of mind.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: Happiness is a butterfly which  when pursued  is always beyond our grasp  but  if you will sit down quietly  may alight upon you.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
author: Rose Wilder Lane

quote: To seek after beauty as an end  is a wild goose chase  a will-o'-the-wisp  because it is to misunderstand the very nature of beauty  which is the normal condition of a thing being as it should be.
author: Ada Bethune

quote: Perfect happiness is the absence of striving for happiness.
author: Chuang-tzu

quote: This will be triumph! This will be happiness! Yea  that very thing  happiness  which I have been pursuing all my life  and have never yet overtaken.
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: I don't sit around thinking that I'd like to have another husband  only another man would make me think that way.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: Pleasure is very seldom found where it is sought. Our brightest blazes are commonly kindled by unexpected sparks.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A sure way to lose happiness  I found  is to want it at the expense of everything else.
author: Bette Davis

quote: Those who seek happiness miss it  and those who discuss it  lack it.
author: Holbrook Jackson

quote: Inspiration never arrived when you were searching for it.
author: Lisa Alther

quote: Nothing is more hopeless than a scheme of merriment.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Happiness is never stopping to think if you are.
author: Palmer Sondreal

quote: It is the paradox of life that the way to miss pleasure is to seek it first. The very first condition of lasting happiness is that a life should be full of purpose  aiming at something outside self.
author: Hugh Black

quote: If you pursue happiness you'll never find it.
author: C. P. Snow

quote: Some of us might find happiness if we quit struggling so desperately for it.
author: William Feather

quote: Seek not happiness too greedily  and be not fearful of unhappiness.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: The man of pleasure  by a vain attempt to be more happy than any man can be  is often more miserable than most men.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The bird of paradise alights only on the hand that does not grasp.
author: John Berry

quote: The only way to happiness is never to give happiness a thought.
author: Elton Trueblood

quote: Everyone chases after happiness  not noticing that happiness is at their heels.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Seek to do good  and you will find that happiness will run after you.
author: James Freeman Clarke

quote: Deliberately to pursue happiness is not the surest way of achieving it. Seek it for its own sake and I doubt whether you will find it.
author: Robert J. McCracken

quote: Enjoyment is not a goal  it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: If only we'd stop trying to be happy we'd have a pretty good time.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Most men pursue pleasure with such breathless haste that they hurry past it.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Happiness comes most to persons who seek it least  and think least about it. It is not an object to be sought  it is a state to be induced. It must follow and not lead. It must overtake you  and not you overtake it.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Happiness sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Happiness is like a cat. If you try to coax it or call it  it will avoid you. It will never come. But if you pay no attention to it and go about your business  you'll find it rubbing against your legs and jumping into your lap.
author: William Bennett

quote: One must never look for happiness: one meets it by the way.
author: Isabelle Eberhardt

quote: They seemed to come suddenly upon happiness as if they had surprised a butterfly in the winter woods.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Happiness in this world  when it comes  comes incidentally. Make it the object of pursuit  and it leads us on a wild-goose chase  and is never attained. Follow some other object  and very possibly we may find that we have caught happiness without dreaming of it.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Happiness and beauty are by-products. Folly is the direct pursuit of happiness and beauty.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: It is the very pursuit of happiness that thwarts happiness.
author: Viktor Frankl

quote: If you ever find happiness by hunting for it  you will find it  as the old woman did her lost spectacles  safe on her nose all the time.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Happiness is not a goal  it is a byproduct.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Happiness is mostly a by-product of doing what makes us feel fulfilled.
author: Dr. Benjamin Spock

quote: Happiness is something you get as a by-product in the process of making something else.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Happiness is not a horse  you cannot harness it.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The attainment of justice is the highest human endeavor.
author: Florence Ellinwood Allen

quote: Conscience  as I understand it  is the impulse to do the right thing because it is right  regardless of personal ends  and has nothing whatever to do with the ability to distinguish between right and wrong.
author: Margaret Collier Graham

quote: I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: The principles we live by  in business and in social life  are the most important part of happiness.
author: Harry Harrison

quote: If you aren't good at loving yourself  you will have a difficult time loving anyone  since you'll resent the time and energy you give another person that you aren't even giving to yourself.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: Happiness is when what you think  what you say  and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A good message will always find a messenger.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: It's no good saying one thing and doing another.
author: Catherine Cookson

quote: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do.
author: Freya Stark

quote: Let how you live your life stand for something  no matter how small and incidental it may seem.
author: Jodie Foster

quote: Happy is the man who ventures boldly to defend what he holds dear.
author: Ovid

quote: It is necessary to the happiness of man that he be mentally faithful to himself.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Happiness is that state of consciousness which proceeds from the achievement of one's values.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: It is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.
author: Erasmus

quote: Resolve to be thyself  and know that who finds himself  loses his misery.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: There is only one history of any importance  and it is the history of what you once believed in  and the history of what you came to believe in.
author: Kay Boyle

quote: The needle of our conscience is as good a compass as any.
author: Ruth Wolff

quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads?
author: Albert Camus

quote: That kind of life is most happy which affords us most opportunities of gaining our own esteem.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Happiness is not something you get  but something you do.
author: Marcelene Cox

quote: Happiness is action.
author: David Thomas

quote: I am enjoying to a full that period of reflection which is the happiest conclusion to a life of action.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Action may not always bring happiness  but there is no happiness without action.
author: William James

quote: I want a busy life  a just mind  and a timely death.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: Happiness is often the result of being too busy to be miserable.
author: Anonymous

quote: Painting's not important. The important thing is keeping busy.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: To attain happiness in another world we need only to believe something  to secure it in this world  we must do something.
author: Charlotte P. Gilman

quote: To fill the hour  and leave no crevice ... that is happiness.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If you observe a really happy man  you will find ... that he is happy in the course of living life twenty-four crowded hours of each day.
author: W. Beran Wolfe

quote: I find my joy of living in the fierce and ruthless battles of life.
author: August Strindberg

quote: Happiness is an expression of the soul in considered actions.
author: Aristotle

quote: We must be doing something to be happy.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Happiness lies in the fulfillment of the spirit through the body.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: We must not seek happiness in peace  but in conflict.
author: Paul Claudel

quote: Happiness walks on busy feet.
author: Kitte Turmell

quote: Our actions are the springs of our happiness or misery.
author: Philip Skelton

quote: The formula for complete happiness is to be very busy.
author: A. Edward Newton

quote: The busiest man is the happiest man.
author: Sir Theodore Martin

quote: To be busy is man's only happiness.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The only way to avoid being miserable is not to have enough leisure to wonder whether you are happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The happiest people are those who are too busy to notice whether they are or not.
author: William Feather

quote: In great moments life seems neither right nor wrong  but something greater: it seems inevitable.
author: Margaret Sherwood

quote: Happiness ... can exist only in acceptance.
author: Denis De Rougemont

quote: Knowledge of what is possible is the beginning of happiness.
author: George Santayana

quote: There is only one way to happiness  and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
author: Epictetus

quote: Happiness comes from ... some curious adjustment to life.
author: Hugh Walpole

quote: Happy is he who learns to bear what he cannot change!
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes  but in liking what one has to do.
author: Sir James M. Barrie

quote: He is happy whose circumstances suit his temper  but he is more excellent who suits his temper to any circumstances.
author: David Hume

quote: Happiness is experienced when your life gives you what you are willing to accept.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Life is not always what one wants it to be  but to make the best of it as it is  is the only way of being happy.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: We deem those happy who from the experience of life have learned to bear its ills  without being overcome by them.
author: Juvenal

quote: This is true joy of life-being used for a purpose that is recognized by yourself as a mighty one ... instead of being a feverish  selfish little clod of ailments and grievances  complaining that the world will not devote itself to making you happy.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Never mind your happiness  do your duty.
author: Will Durant

quote: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
author: George Washington

quote: When we ... devote ourselves to the strict and unsparing performance of duty  then happiness comes of itself.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: Seek happiness for its own sake  and you will not find it  seek for duty  and happiness will follow as the shadow comes with the sunshine.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: True happiness ... is not attained through self-gratification  but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
author: William Cowper

quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: The happiest excitement in life is to be convinced that one is fighting for all one is worth on behalf of some clearly seen and deeply felt good.
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: True happiness  we are told  consists in getting out of one's self. But the point is not only to get out  you must stay out. And to stay out  you must have some absorbing errand.
author: Henry James

quote: The secret of living is to find ... the pivot of a concept on which you can make your stand.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: A man's happiness: to do the things proper to man.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Happy [is] the man who knows his duties!
author: Christian Furchtegott Gellert

quote: The only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: He who never sacrificed a present to a future good  or a personal to a general one  can speak of happiness only as the blind speak of color.
author: Horace Mann

quote: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accom plished something.
author: Henry Ford

quote: I believe half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
author: William J. Locke

quote: The full-grown modern human being ... is conscious of touching the highest pinnacle of fulfillment... when he is consumed in the service of an idea  in the conquest of the goal pursued.
author: R. Briffault

quote: Happiness is essentially a state of going somewhere  wholeheartedly  one-directionally  without regret or reservation.
author: William H. Sheldon

quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.
author: L. Ron Hubbard

quote: Give a man health and a course to steer  and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Having a goal is a state of happiness.
author: E. J. Bartek

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achieve ment and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: Without duty  life is soft and bone less.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: It is always the simple that produces the marvelous.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: Happiness consists not in having much  but in being content with little.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: Man is meant for happiness and this happiness is in him  in the satisfaction of the daily needs of his existence.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I have had more than half a century of such happiness. A great deal of worry and sorrow  too  but never a worry or a sorrow that was not offset by a purple iris  a lark  a bluebird  or a dewy morning glory.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: A multitude of small delights constitute happiness.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions-the little  soon-forgotten charities of a kiss or smile  a kind look  a heart-felt compliment  and the countless infinitesimals of pleasurable and genial feeling.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: For me it is sufficient to have a corner by my hearth  a book and a friend  and a nap undisturbed by creditors or grief.
author: Fernandez de Andrada

quote: A happy life is made up of little things ... a gift sent  a letter written  a call made  a recommendation given  transportation provided  a cake made  a book lent  a check sent.
author: Carol Holmes

quote: Yes  there is a Nirvanah  it is in leading your sheep to a green pasture  and in putting your child to sleep  and in writing the last line of your poem.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: First health  then wealth  then pleasure  and do not owe anything to anybody.
author: Catherine the Great

quote: I know well that happiness is in little things.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Sooner or later we all discover that the important moments in life are not the advertised ones  not the birthdays  the graduations  the weddings  not the great goals achieved. The real milestones are less prepossessing. They come to the door of memory.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I don't think about whether people will remember me or not. I've been an okay person. I've learned a lot. I've taught people a thing or two. That's what's important.
author: Julia Child

quote: What would life be without art? Science prolongs life. To consist of what-eating  drinking  and sleeping? What is the good of living longer if it is only a matter of satisfying the requirements that sustain life? All this is nothing without the charm of art.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

quote: It is by studying little things that we attain the great knowledge of having as little misery and as much happiness as possible.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The happiest people I have known in this world have been the Saints-and  after these  the men and women who get immediate and conscious enjoyment from little things.
author: Hugh Walpole

quote: The little things are infinitely the most important.
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: We women ought to put first things first. Why should we mind if men have their faces on the money  as long as we get our hands on it?
author: Ivy Baker Priest

quote: Eating is not merely a material pleasure. Eating well gives a spectacular joy to life and contributes immensely to goodwill and happy companionship. It is of great importance to the morale.
author: Elsa Schiapirelli

quote: I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet  simple things of life which are the real ones after all.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quote: Happiness consists more in small conveniences or pleasures that occur every day  than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The happiness of most people is not ruined by great catastrophes or fatal errors  but by the repetition of slowly destructive little things.
author: Ernest Dimnet

quote: Enjoy the little things  for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Robert Brault

quote: Why not learn to enjoy the little things-there are so many of them.
author: Anonymous

quote: Anyone who's a great kisser I'm always interested in.
author: Cher

quote: Moderation. Small helpings. Sample a little bit of everything. These are the secrets of happiness and good health.
author: Julia Child

quote: The best things are nearest: breath in your nostrils  light in your eyes  flowers at your feet  duties at your hand  the path of God just before you. Then do not grasp at the stars  but do life's plain  common work as it comes  certain that daily duties and daily bread are the sweetest things of life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: In violent and chaotic times such as these  our only chance for survival lies in creating our own little islands of sanity and order  in making little havens of our homes.
author: Susan Kaufman

quote: Small kindnesses  small courtesies  small considerations  habitually practiced in our social intercourse  give a greater charm to the character than the display of great talents and accomplishments.
author: Mary Ann Kelty

quote: For most of life  nothing wonderful happens. If you don't enjoy getting up and working and finishing your work and sitting down to a meal with family or friends  then the chances are you're not going to be very happy. If someone bases his happiness or unhappiness on major events like a great new job  huge amounts of money  a flawlessly happy marriage or a trip to Paris  that person isn't going to be happy much of the time. If  on the other hand  happiness depends on a good breakfast  flowers in the yard  a drink or a nap  then we are more likely to live with quite a bit of happiness.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: The mere sense of living is joy enough.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The true way to soften one's troubles is to solace those of others.
author: Madame De Maintenon

quote: To complain that life has no joys while there is a single creature whom we can relieve by our bounty  assist by our counsels or enliven by our presence  is... just as rational as to die of thirst with the cup in our hands.
author: Thomas Fitzosborne

quote: We learn the inner secret of happiness when we learn to direct our inner drives  our interest  and our attention to something besides ourselves.
author: Ethel Percy Andrus

quote: Little deeds of kindness  little words of love  Help to make earth happy like the heaven up above.
author: Julia A. Fletcher Carney

quote: In about the same degree as you are helpful  you will be happy.
author: Karl Reiland

quote: Hire the best. Pay them fairly. Communicate frequently. Provide challenges and rewards. Believe in them. Get out of their way and they'll knock your socks off.
author: Mary Ann Allison

quote: Treat a horse like a woman and a woman like a horse. And they'll both win for you.
author: Elizabeth Arden

quote: Invest in the human soul. Who knows  it might be a diamond in the rough.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: All the goodness  beauty  and perfection of a human being belong to the one who knows how to recognize these qualities.
author: Georgette Leblanc

quote: You cannot always have happiness  but you can always give happiness.
author: Anonymous

quote: The nice thing about teamwork is that you always have others on your side.
author: Margaret Carty

quote: No one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: Happiness is a by-product of helping others.
author: Denny Miller

quote: The most exquisite pleasure is giving pleasure to others.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: No man can live happily who regards himself alone  who turns everything to his own advantage. Thou must live for another if thou wishest to live for thyself.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Scatter seeds of kindness everywhere you go  Scatter bits of courtesy-watch them grow and grow. Gather buds of friendship  keep them till full-blown  You will find more happiness than you have ever known.
author: Amy R. Raabe

quote: If all our happiness is bound up entirely in our personal circumstances  it is difficult not to demand of life more than it has to give.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: No man is more cheated than the selfish man.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The habit of being uniformly considerate toward others will bring increased happiness to you.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: If you have not often felt the joy of doing a kind act  you have neglected much  and most of all yourself.
author: A. Neilen

quote: We cannot hold a torch to light another's path without brightening our own.
author: Ben Sweetland

quote: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others  but it also becomes richer and happier.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Happiness ... consists in giving  and in serving others.
author: Henry Drummond

quote: Pleasure is a reciprocal  no one feels it who does not at the same time give it. To be pleased  one must please.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: He that despiseth his neighbor sin-neth  but he that hath mercy on the poor  happy is he.
author: Bible

quote: Instinct teaches us to look for happiness outside ourselves.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: A bit of fragrance always clings to the hand that gives you roses.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: When you dig another out of their troubles  you find a place to bury your own.
author: Anonymous

quote: One thing I know: the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Caring about others  running the risk of feeling  and leaving an impact on people  brings happiness.
author: Rabbi Harold Kushner

quote: The entire sum of existence is the magic of being needed by just one person.
author: Vi Putnam

quote: One of the things I keep learning is that the secret of being happy is doing things for other people.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: Make one person happy each day and in forty years you will have made 14 600 human beings happy for a little time  at least.
author: Charley Willey

quote: The most satisfying thing in life is to have been able to give a large part of oneself to others.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quote: To be kind to all  to like many and love a few  to be needed and wanted by those we love  is certainly the nearest we can come to happiness.
author: Mary Roberts Rinehart

quote: Seldom can the heart be lonely  If it seeks a lonelier still  Self-forgetting  seeking only Emptier cups of love to fill.
author: Frances Ridley Havergal

quote: The older you get  the more you realize that kindness is synonymous with happiness.
author: Lionel Barrymore

quote: There is no happiness in having or in getting  but only in giving.
author: Henry Drummond

quote: Make happy those who are near  and those who are far will come.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: True happiness consists in making others happy.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: All who would win joy  must share it  happiness was born a twin.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Happiness is not so much in having as sharing. We make a living by what we get  but we make a life by what we give.
author: Norman MacEwan

quote: Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness  it has no taste.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: Happiness is a sunbeam which may pass through a thousand bosoms without losing a particle of its original ray  nay  when it strikes on a kindred heart  like the converged light on a mirror  it reflects itself with redoubled brightness. It is not perfected till it is shared.
author: Jane Porter

quote: The tourist may complain of other tourists  but he would be lost without them.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: Unshared joy is an unlighted candle.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: A joy that's shared is a joy made double.
author: English proverb

quote: The human heart  at whatever age  opens only to the heart that opens in return.
author: Maria Edgeworth

quote: Happiness is the cheapest thing in the world ... when we buy it for someone else.
author: Paul Flemming

quote: To get the full value of a joy you must have somebody to divide it with.
author: Mark Twain

quote: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: When someone does something good  applaud! You will make two people happy.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: Happiness is not perfected until it is shared.
author: Jane Porter

quote: Happiness ... is achieved only by making others happy.
author: Stuart Cloete

quote: Our Thoughts Determine Our Happiness High above hate I dwell  0 storms! Farewell.
author: Louise Imogen Guiney

quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: 1 am happy and content because I think I am.
author: Alain-Rene Lesage

quote: All happiness is in the mind.
author: Anonymous

quote: Happiness is not a matter of events  it depends upon the tides of the mind.
author: Alice Meynell

quote: A happy life consists in tranquility of mind.
author: Cicero

quote: The real winners in life are the people who look at every situation with an expectation that they can make it work or make it better.
author: Barbara Pletcher

quote: A man's as miserable as he thinks he is.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts.
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: Unhappiness indicates wrong thinking  just as ill health indicates a bad regimen.
author: Paul Bourget

quote: He is happy that knoweth not himself to be otherwise.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our dispositions  and not our circumstances.
author: Martha Washington

quote: Happiness does not depend on outward things  but on the way we see them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Happiness will never be any greater than the idea we have of it.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: We are never so happy or so unhappy as we think.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Misery is almost always the result of thinking.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
author: Bernard de Fontenelle

quote: It isn't our position  but our disposition  that makes us happy.
author: Anonymous

quote: A man's happiness or unhappiness depends as much on his temperament as on his destiny.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: I went back to being an amateur  in the sense of somebody who loves what she is doing. If a professional loses the love of work  routine sets in  and that's the death of work and life.
author: Ada Bethune

quote: The high prize of life  the crowning fortune of man  is to be born with a bias to some pursuit which finds him in employment and happiness.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The medals don't mean anything and the glory doesn't last. It's all about your happiness. The rewards are going to come  but my happiness is just loving the sport and having fun performing.
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

quote: The road to happiness lies in two simple principles: find what it is that interests you and that you can do well  and when you find it put your whole soul into it-every bit of energy and ambition and natural ability you have.
author: John D. Rockefeller III

quote: They are happy men whose natures sort with their vocations.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Happiness consists in the full employment of our faculties in some pursuit.
author: Harriet Martineau

quote: The happy people are those who are producing something.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Congenial labor is the secret of happiness.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: To find out what one is fitted to do  and to secure an opportunity to do it  is the key to happiness.
author: John Dewey

quote: If I were to suggest a general rule for happiness  I would say "Work a little harder  Work a little longer  Work!"
author: Frederick H. Ecker

quote: To make a man happy  fill his hands with work.
author: Frederick E. Crane

quote: Work is the true elixir of life. The busiest man is the happiest man.
author: Sir Theodore Martin

quote: Happiness ... loves to see men work. She loves sweat  weariness  self-sacrifice. She will not be found in the palaces  but lurking in cornfields and factories  and hovering over littered desks.
author: David Grayson

quote: Every job has drudgery. ... The first secret of happiness is the recognition of this fundamental fact.
author: M. C. Mcintosh

quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: There is work that is work and there is play that is play  there is play that is work and work that is play. And in only one of these lie happiness.
author: Gelett Burgess

quote: Employment... is so essential to human happiness that indolence is justly considered the mother of misery.
author: Robert Burton

quote: Happiness comes only when we push our brains and hearts to the farthest reaches of which we are capable.
author: Leo C. Rosten

quote: A man is relieved and gay when he has put his heart into his work and done his best.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There is certainly no greater happiness than to be able to look back on a life usefully and virtuously employed  to trace our own progress in existence by such tokens as excite neither shame nor sorrow.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Continuity of purpose is one of the most essential ingredients of happiness in the long run  and for most men this comes chiefly through their work.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Blessed is he who has found his work  let him ask no other blessedness. He has a work  a life-purpose. ... Get your happiness out of your work or you will never know what real happiness is. ... Even in the meanest sorts of labor  the whole soul of a man is composed into a kind of real harmony the instant he sets himself to work.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Man is happy only as he finds a work worth doing-and does it well.
author: E. Merrill Root

quote: Life without absorbing occupation is hell.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Few persons realize how much of their happiness  such as it is  is dependent upon their work.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Joy is the will which labours  which overcomes obstacles  which knows triumph.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Get happiness out of your work or you may never know what happiness is.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: When men are rightly occupied  their amusement grows out of their work  as the color-petals out of a fruitful flower.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Parents  however old they and we may grow to be  serve among other things to shield us from a sense of our doom. As long as they are around  we can avoid the fact of our mortality  we can still be innocent children.
author: Jane Howard

quote: You leave home to seek your fortune and  when you get it  you go home and share it with your family.
author: Anita Baker

quote: Sometimes the strength of motherhood is greater than natural laws.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: He is happiest  be he king or peasant  who finds peace in his home.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: My child looked at me and I looked back at him in the delivery room  and I realized that out of a sea of infinite possibilities it had come down to this: a specific person  born on the hottest day of the year  conceived on a Christmas Eve  made by his father and me miraculously from scratch.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: And when our baby stirs and struggles to be born it compels humility: what we began is now its own.
author: Anne Ridler

quote: What families have in common the world around is that they are the place where people learn who they are and how to be that way.
author: Jean Illsley Clarke

quote: Family life is the source of the greatest human happiness.
author: Robert J. Havighurst

quote: Where thou art  that is home.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Parenting  at its best  comes as naturally as laughter. It is automatic  involuntary  unconditional love.
author: Sally James

quote: If this world affords true happiness  it is to be found in a home where love and confidence increase with the years  where the necessities of life come without severe strain  where luxuries enter only after their cost has been carefully considered.
author: A. Edward Newton

quote: There are four things a child needs: plenty of love  nourishing food  regular sleep  and lots of soap and water.
author: Ivy Baker Priest

quote: Family jokes  though rightly cursed by strangers  are the bond that keeps most families alive.
author: Stella Benson

quote: The secret of a happy marriage is finding the right person. You know they're right if you love to be with them all of the time.
author: Julia Child

quote: An easygoing husband is the one indispensable comfort of life.
author: Ouida

quote: My father got me strong and straight and slim And I give thanks to him. My mother bore me glad and sound and sweet  I kiss her feet.
author: Marguerite Wilkinson

quote: A house is not a home unless it contains food and fire for the mind as well as the body.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: No music is so pleasant to my ears as that word-father.
author: Lydia M. Child

quote: He who leaves his house in search of happiness pursues a shadow.
author: Anonymous

quote: If solid happiness we prize  within our breast this jewel lies  And they are fools who roam  the world has nothing to bestow  From our own selves our bliss must flow  And that dear hut-our home.
author: Nathaniel Cotton

quote: Happiness grows at our own firesides  and is not to be picked in strangers' gardens.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: A mother's arms are more comforting than anyone else's.
author: Diana, Princess of Wales

quote: He who would be happy should stay at home.
author: Greek proverb

quote: Every family is a "normal" family- no matter whether it has one parent  two  or no children at all.
author: Shere Hite

quote: Within our family there was no such thing as a person who did not matter. Second cousins thrice removed mattered.
author: Shirley Abbott

quote: All the wealth of the world cannot be compared with the happiness of living together happily united.
author: Saint Mary Margaret d'Youville

quote: There's a thread that binds all of us together  pull one end of the thread  the strain is felt all down the line.
author: Rosamond Marshall

quote: Love from one being to another can only be that two solitudes come nearer  recognize and protect and comfort each other.
author: Han Suyin

quote: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: Where there is laughter there is always more health than sickness.
author: Phyllis Bottome

quote: In the Orient people believed that the basis of all disease was unhappiness. Thus to make a patient happy again was to restore him to health.
author: Donald Law

quote: Loving  like prayer  is a power as well as a process. It's curative. It is creative.
author: Zona Gale

quote: The simple truth is that happy people generally don't get sick.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: Laughter is by definition healthy.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: Laughter is the best medicine.
author: Anonymous

quote: Love is the great miracle cure. Loving ourselves works miracles in our lives.
author: Louise L. Hay

quote: Happiness is not being pained in body nor troubled in mind.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: One of the quickest ways to become exhausted is by suppressing your feelings.
author: Sue Patton Thoele

quote: Being asked one day what was the surest way of remaining happy in this world  the Emperor Sigismund of Germany replied: "Only do in health what you have promised to do when you were sick."
author: Anonymous

quote: The best things in life aren't things.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Money  or even power  can never yield happiness unless it be accompanied by the goodwill of others.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: To fulfill a dream  to be allowed to sweat over lonely labor  to be given the chance to create  is the meat and potatoes of life. The money is the gravy.
author: Bette Davis

quote: I don't want to make money. I just want to be wonderful.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: It's pretty hard to tell what does bring happiness  poverty and wealth have both failed.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: It is neither wealth nor splendor  but tranquility and occupation  which give happiness.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Joy has nothing to do with material things  or with a man's outward circumstance ... a man living in the lap of luxury can be wretched  and a man in the depths of poverty can overflow with joy.
author: William Barclay

quote: Hope costs nothing.
author: Colette

quote: Getting what you go after is success  but liking it while you are getting it is happiness.
author: Bertha Damon

quote: Success can also cause misery. The trick is not to be surprised when you discover it doesn't bring you all the happiness and answers you thought it would.
author: Prince

quote: No social system will bring us happiness  health and prosperity unless it is inspired by something greater than materialism.
author: Clement R. Attlee

quote: The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things.
author: Epictetus

quote: Happiness depends  as Nature shows  less on exterior things than most suppose.
author: William Cowper

quote: There are two things to aim at in life: first  to get what you want  and  after that  to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants  and the other is getting it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A life of frustration is inevitable for any coach whose main enjoyment is winning.
author: Chuck Noll

quote: Money is human happiness in the abstract  he  then  who is no longer capable of enjoying human happiness in the concrete devotes himself utterly to money.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Happiness seems to require a modicum of external prosperity.
author: Aristotle

quote: Those who have easy  cheerful attitudes tend to be happier than those with less pleasant temperaments regardless of money  "making it" or success.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Money  or even power  can never yield happiness unless it be accompanied by the goodwill of others.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: The secret of happiness is to admire without desiring.
author: EH. Bradley

quote: Few rich men own their own property. Their property owns them.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: We can be wise from goodness and good from wisdom.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: She knew what all smart women knew: Laughter made you live better and longer.
author: Gail Parent

quote: An Arabian proverb says there are four sorts of men: He who knows not and knows not he knows not: he is a fool-shun him. He who knows not and knows he knows not: he is simple-teach him. He who knows and knows not he knows: he is asleep-wake him. He who knows and knows he knows: he is wise-follow him.
author: Lady Isabel Burton

quote: There are only two things that are absolute realities  love and knowledge  and you can't escape them.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: Wisdom is the most important part of happiness.
author: Sophocles

quote: Knowledge is the prime need of the hour.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: Better be happy than wise.
author: Anonymous

quote: Be happy. It's one way of being wise.
author: Colette

quote: With happiness comes intelligence to the heart.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Joy is the holy fire that keeps our purpose warm and our intelligence aglow.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Our happiness depends on wisdom all the way.
author: Sophocles

quote: The genius of happiness is still so rare  is indeed on the whole the rarest genius. To possess it means to approach life with the humility of a beggar  but to treat it with the proud generosity of a prince  to bring to its totality the deep understanding of a great poet and to each of its moments the abandonment and ingenuousness of a child.
author: Ellen Key

quote: What matters most is that we learn from living.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: Best trust the happy moments. ... The days that make us happy make us wise.
author: John Masefield

quote: It is an aspect of all happiness to suppose that we deserve it.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: A garden isn't meant to be useful. It's for joy.
author: Rumer Godden

quote: A reasonable man needs only to practice moderation to find happiness.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: To forget oneself is to be happy.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Happiness is a resultant of the relative strengths of positive and negative feelings rather than an absolute amount of one or the other.
author: Norman Bradburn

quote: The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditations on the past.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Man needs  for his happiness  not only the enjoyment of this or that  but hope and enterprise and change.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Happy is the man who can do only one thing  in doing it  he fulfills his destiny.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: And may I live the remainder of my life ... for myself  may there be plenty of books and many years' store of the fruits of the earth!
author: Horace

quote: Behold  we count them happy which endure.
author: Bible

quote: The will of man is his happiness.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Happiness to a dog is what lies on the other side of the door.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence  but in the mastery  of his passions.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: It is comparison that makes men happy or miserable.
author: Anonymous

quote: Let him that would be happy for a day  go to the barber  for a week  marry a wife  for a month  buy him a new horse  for a year  build him a new house  for all his lifetime  be an honest man.
author: Anonymous

quote: Who will present pleasure refrain  shall in time to come the more pleasure obtain.
author: Anonymous

quote: A happy life must be to a great extent a quiet life  for it is only in an atmosphere of quiet that true joy can live.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: It is in virtue that happiness consists  for virtue is the state of mind which tends to make the whole of life harmonious.
author: Zeno

quote: To live we must conquer incessantly  we must have the courage to be happy.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Happiness has many roots  but none more important than security.
author: E. R. Stettinius

quote: No man can be merry unless he is serious.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Happy [is] the man who has learned the cause of things and has put under his feet all fear  inexorable fate  and the noisy strife of the hell of greed.
author: Virgil

quote: The happiest man is he who learns from nature the lesson of worship.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It takes great wit and interest and energy to be happy. The pursuit of happiness is a great activity. One must be open and alive. It is the greatest feat man has to accomplish.
author: Robert Henri

quote: Talk happiness. The world is sad enough without your woe. No path is wholly rough.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life  when all that we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: What we call happiness is what we do not know.
author: Anatole France

quote: For the happiest life  days should be rigorously planned  nights left open to chance.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Happy people plan actions  they don't plan results.
author: Dennis Wholey

quote: If you want others to be happy  practice compassion. If you want to be happy  practice compassion.
author: The Dalai Lama

quote: It is neither wealth nor splendor  but tranquility and occupation  which give happiness.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The best way for a person to have happy thoughts is to count his blessings and not his cash.
author: Anonymous

quote: All happiness depends on a leisurely breakfast.
author: John Gunther

quote: Happy is he who still loves something he loved in the nursery: He has not been broken in two by time  he is not two men  but one  and he has saved not only his soul  but his life.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: To be happy means to be free  not from pain or fear  but from care or anxiety.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: The art of living does not consist in preserving and clinging to a particular mode of happiness  but in allowing happiness to change its form without being disappointed by the change  happiness  like a child  must be allowed to grow up.
author: Charles L. Morgan

quote: Just as a cautious businessman avoids investing all his capital in one concern  so wisdom would probably admonish us also not to anticipate all our happiness from one quarter alone.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Growth itself contains the germ of happiness.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: We live in an ascending scale when we live happily  one thing leading to another in an endless series.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Happiness is not a station to arrive at  but a manner of traveling.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: Everyone only goes around the track once in life  and if you don't enjoy that trip  it's pretty pathetic.
author: Gary Rogers

quote: I believe that a worthwhile life is defined by a kind of spiritual journey and a sense of obligation.
author: Hillary Rodham Clinton

quote: The really happy man is one who can enjoy the scenery on a detour.
author: Anonymous

quote: Happiness is to be found along the way  not at the end of the road  for then the journey is over and it is too late.
author: Robert R. Updegraff

quote: Spiritual life is like a moving sidewalk. Whether you go with it or spend your whole life running against it  you're still going to be taken along.
author: Bernadette Roberts

quote: Happiness is a way station between too little and too much.
author: Channing Pollock

quote: Enjoy your happiness while you have it  and while you have it do not too closely scrutinize its foundation.
author: Joseph Farrell

quote: Suspicion of happiness is in our blood.
author: E. V. Lucas

quote: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch  but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
author: Helen Keller

quote: My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither  but just enjoy your ice cream while it's on your plate.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can only be felt if you don't set any condition.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

quote: Ask yourself whether you are happy  and you will cease to be so.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Best to live lightly  unthinkingly.
author: Sophocles

quote: The secret of being miserable is to have leisure to bother about whether you are happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: To describe happiness is to diminish it.
author: Stendhal

quote: My life has no purpose  no direction  no aim  no meaning  and yet I'm happy. I can't figure it out. What am I doing right?
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: People who postpone happiness are like children who try chasing rainbows in an effort to find the pot of gold at the rainbow's end. ... Your life will never be fulfilled until you are happy here and now.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: Happiness consists of living each day as if it were the first day of your honeymoon and the last day of your vacation.
author: Anonymous

quote: For a long time it seemed to me that real life was about to begin  but there was always some obstacle in the way. Something had to be got through first  some unfinished business  time still to be served  a debt to be paid. Then life would begin. At last it dawned on me that these obstacles were my life.
author: Bette Howland

quote: Every minute your mouth is turned down you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
author: Tom Walsh

quote: Why not seize the pleasure at once? How often is happiness destroyed by preparation  foolish preparation?
author: Jane Austen

quote: Enjoy yourself. These are the "good old days" you're going to miss in the years ahead.
author: Anonymous

quote: No pleasure without pain.
author: Anonymous

quote: But here's what I've learned in this war  in this country  in this city: to love the miracle of having been born.
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: Pleasure is not pleasant unless it cost dear.
author: Anonymous

quote: The sweetest joy  the wildest woe is love.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: So they speak soothingly about progress and the greatest possible happiness  forgetting that happiness is itself poisoned if the measure of suffering has not been fulfilled.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Sadness and gladness succeed each other.
author: Anonymous

quote: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
author: William Saroyan

quote: Happiness comes fleetingly now and then to those who have learned to do without it  and to them only.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Unquestionably  it is possible to do without happiness  it is done involuntarily by nineteen-twentieths of mankind.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Perfect happiness is the absence of striving for happiness.
author: Chuang-tzu

quote: Happiness lies in the consciousness we have of it.
author: George Sand

quote: There are men who are happy without knowing it.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Eden is that old-fashioned house we dwell in every day without suspecting our abode until we drive away.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Why is it that so many people are afraid to admit that they are happy?
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: Man's real life is happy  chiefly because he is ever expecting that it soon will be so.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: What a wonderful life I've had! I only wish I'd realized it sooner.
author: Colette

quote: Those who are the most happy appear to know it the least  happiness is something that for the most part seems to mainly consist in not knowing it.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: We are all happy  if we only knew it.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: Eden is that old-fashioned house we dwell in every day Without suspecting our abode until we drive away.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Happiness is a Swedish sunset  it is there for all  but most of us look the other way and lose it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Paradise is exactly like where you are right now ... only much  much better.
author: Laurie Anderson

quote: Time is compressed like the fist I close on my knee ... I hold inside it the clues and solutions and the power for what I must do now.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: The major job was getting people to understand that they had something within their power that they could use.
author: Ella Baker

quote: Each moment in time we have it all  even when we think we don't.
author: Melody Beattie

quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands  but let it go  and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Contentment is not happiness. An oyster may be contented. Happiness is compounded of richer elements.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Everything has its wonders  even darkness and silence  and I learn  whatever state I may be in  therein to be content.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The world is full of people looking for spectacular happiness while they snub contentment.
author: Doug Larson

quote: Happiness is a rare plant that seldom takes root on earth-few ever enjoyed it  except for a brief period  the search after it is rarely rewarded by the discovery  but there is an admirable substitute for it... a contented spirit.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: If all were gentle and contented as sheep  all would be as feeble and helpless.
author: John Lancaster Spalding

quote: The world of those who are happy is different from the world of those who are not.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: My heart is like a singing bird.
author: Christina Georgina Tossetti

quote: I don't think being an athlete is unfeminine. I think of it as a kind of grace.
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

quote: If happiness truly consisted in physical ease and freedom from care  then the happiest individual... would be  I think  an American cow.
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: My happiness is not the means to any end. It is the end. It is its own goal. It is its own purpose.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: When unhappy  one doubts everything  when happy  one doubts nothing.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: The more the heart is sated with joy  the more it becomes insatiable.
author: Gabrielle Roy

quote: There is a courage of happiness as well as a courage of sorrow.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: The truth is  laughter always sounds more perfect than weeping. Laughter flows in a violent riff and is effortlessly melodic. Weeping is often fought  choked  half strangled  or surrendered to with humiliation.
author: Anne Rice

quote: No man is happy unless he believes he is.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Who is the happiest of men? He who values the merits of others  And in their pleasure takes joy  even as though t'were his own.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Only man clogs his happiness with care  destroying what is  with thoughts of what may be.
author: John Dryden

quote: If you obey all the rules you miss all the fun.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: We never enjoy perfect happiness  our most fortunate successes are mingled with sadness  some anxieties always perplex the reality of our satisfaction.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: Happiness is not the end of life  character is.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Human life is basically a comedy. Even its tragedies often seem comic to the spectator  and not infrequently they actually have comic touches to the victim. Happiness probably consists largely in the capacity to detect and relish them.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: We may fail of our happiness  strive we ever so bravely  but we are less likely to fail if we measure with judgement our chances and our capabilities.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: We always have enough to be happy if we are enjoying what we do have- and not worrying about what we don't have.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: That sanguine expectation of happiness which is happiness itself.
author: Jane Austen

quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
author: Bernard de Fontenelle

quote: If you always do what interests you  at least one person is pleased.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Suffering is not a prerequisite for happiness.
author: Judy Tatelbaum

quote: He is happy that knoweth not himself to be otherwise.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: That man is happiest who lives from day to day and asks no more  garnering the simple goodness of a life.
author: Euripides

quote: Change is an easy panacea. It takes character to stay in one place and be happy there.
author: Elizabeth Clarke Dunn

quote: Such is the state of life that none are happy but by the anticipation of change. The change itself is nothing  when we have made it the next wish is to change again.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Life delights in life.
author: William Blake

quote: I look at what I have not and think myself unhappy  others look at what I have and think me happy.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: Part of the happiness of life consists not in fighting battles  but in avoiding them. A masterly retreat is in itself a victory.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: If only we'd stop trying to be happy we'd have a pretty good time.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: If ignorance is bliss  why aren't there more happy teenagers?
author: Anonymous

quote: As the sergeant said to the recruit: "You might as well be happy  mate - no one cares if you ain't."
author: Ralph Ricketts

quote: I am one of those people who just can't help getting a kick out of life - even when it's a kick in the teeth.
author: Paula Adler

quote: Most folk are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Give a man health and a course to steer  and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: It's pretty hard to tell what does bring happiness. Poverty and wealth have both failed.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Happiness? That's nothing more than health and a poor memory.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: When I was young I used to think that wealth and power would bring me happiness. I was right.
author: Graham Wilson

quote: I look better  feel better  make love better  and I'll tell you something else ... I never lied better.
author: George Burns

quote: The greatest happiness of the greatest number.
author: Cesare Beccaria

quote: What is the worth of anything  But for the happiness 'twill bring?
author: Richard Owen Cambridge

quote: Happiness lies  first of all  in health.
author: George William Curtis

quote: Happiness grows at our own firesides  and is not to be picked in strangers' gardens.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: We are never so happy  nor so unhappy  as we suppose ourselves to be.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: What happiness is there which is not purchased with more or less of pain?
author: Margaret Oliphant

quote: I have learned to seek my happiness by limiting my desires  rather than in attempting to satisfy them.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Everyone speaks of it  few know it.
author: Mme. Jeanne P. Roland

quote: Man is the artificer of his own happiness.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Acting is happy agony.
author: Alec Guinness

quote: Even if we can't be happy  we must always be cheerful.
author: Irving Kristol

quote: Behold  we count them happy which endure. Ye have heard of the patience of Job.
author: Bible

quote: Make happy those who are near  and those who are far will come.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The learned is happy  nature to explore  the fool is happy  that he knows no more.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I'm so happy to be rich  I'm willing to take all the consequences.
author: Howard Ahmanson

quote: The happy man is he who knows his limitations  yet bows to no false gods.
author: Robert Service

quote: Make us happy and you make us good.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Happy is he that chastens himself.
author: Anonymous

quote: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Happy is the man who ventures boldly to defend what he holds dear.
author: Ovid

quote: Happy is he who learns to bear what he cannot change!
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: True happiness consists in making others happy.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: A happy life consists in tranquility of mind.
author: Cicero

quote: The happy people are those who are producing something.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Better be happy than wise.
author: Anonymous

quote: Happy people plan actions  they don't plan results.
author: Dennis Wholey

quote: Happy is he who still loves something he loved in the nursery: He has not been broken in two by time  he is not two men  but one  and he has saved not only his soul  but his life.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Man's real life is happy  chiefly because he is ever expecting that it soon will be so.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: The happy and efficient people in this world are those who accept trouble as a normal detail of human life and resolve to capitalize it when it comes along.
author: H. Bertram Lewis

quote: Happy is the man who can do only one thing: in doing it  he fulfills his destiny.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: No one is happy all his life long.
author: Euripides

quote: Acting is happy agony.
author: Alec Guinness

quote: Even if we can't be happy  we must always be cheerful.

quote: Happy is the man who can do only one thing: in doing it  he fulfills his destiny.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: No one is happy all his life long.
author: Euripides

quote: Whatsoever a man soweth  that shall he also reap.
author: Galatians

quote: The harvest truly is plenteous  but the labourers are few.
author: Matthew

quote: Dry August and warm  Doth harvest no harm.
author: Thomas Tusser

quote: Haste makes waste.
author: English proverb

quote: Take time for all things.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Haste is of the Devil.
author: Koran

quote: Make haste slowly.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer.
author: Anonymous

quote: I like a good hater.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: But I do hate him as I hate the devil.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: The hatred we bear our enemies injures their happiness less than our own.
author: J. Petit-Senn

quote: People hate  as they love  unreasonably.
author: William Thackeray

quote: Few people can be happy unless they hate some other person  nation  or creed.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Who can refute a sneer?
author: William Paley

quote: Hatred is the coward's revenge for being intimidated.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Hatred comes from the heart  contempt from the head  and neither feeling is quite within our control.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Hatred seems to operate on the same glands as love  it even produces the same actions. If we had not been taught how to interpret the story of the Passion  would we have been able to say from their actions alone whether it was the jealous Judas or the cowardly Peter who loved Christ?
author: Graham Greene

quote: I do desire we may be better strangers.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Psychiatrists today . . . see the irrational hostility that people everywhere vent upon one another as chiefly projected self-hate.
author: Bonaro Overstreet

quote: Don't hate  it's too big a burden to bear.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: A hateful act is the transference to others of the degradation we bear in ourselves.
author: Simone Weil

quote: The worst  the least curable hatred is that which has superseded deep love.
author: Euripides

quote: Hatred is settled anger.
author: Cicero

quote: Passionate hatred can give meaning and purpose to an empty life.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Hate is the consequence of fear  we fear something before we hate it  a child who fears noises becomes a man who hates noise.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Hatred is self-punishment.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: Hatreds are the cinders of affection.
author: Walter Raleigh

quote: I never hated a man enough to give him his diamonds back.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quote: It does not matter much what a man hates  provided he hates something.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Whom they have injured  they also hate.
author: Seneca

quote: We love without reason  and without reason we hate.
author: Jean-Frangois Regnard

quote: If you hate a person  you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Hate is such a luxurious emotion  it can only be spent on one we love.
author: Bob Udkoff

quote: An old head upon young shoulders.
author: English Phrase

quote: Two heads are better than one.
author: English proverb

quote: The head is always the dupe of the heart.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: The good Lord never gives you more than you can handle. Unless you die of something.
author: Guindon Cartoon

quote: You can't lose weight without exercise. But I've got a philosophy about exercise. I don't think you should punish your legs for something your mouth did. Drag your lips around the block once or twice.
author: Gary Owens

quote: To improve your memory  lend people money.
author: Anonymous

quote: Health food makes me sick.
author: Calvin Trillin

quote: She is such a health food nut  she thinks a grape is wine in pill form.
author: Elmer Pasta

quote: The art of medicine consists of amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
author: Voltaire

quote: God heals and the doctor takes the fee.
author: Ben Franklin

quote: Diets are for people who are thick and tired of it.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: I've been on a constant diet for the last two decades. I've lost a total of 789 pounds. By all accounts  I should be hanging from a charm bracelet.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Lord  if you can't make me thin -  can you make all my friends fat?
author: Judy Hampton

quote: If I am ever stuck on a respirator or a life support system  I definitely want to be unplugged but not until I get down to size eight.
author: Henriette Montel

quote: My husband lost a lot of weight on a new diet  and I resent it. It's simple  he just doesn't eat when I'm talking.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: I've been on every diet in the world. The best one is the BBC diet: Buy Bigger Clothes.
author: Gary Owens

quote: You don't get ulcers from what you eat. You get them from what's eating you.
author: Vicki Baum

quote: Whenever I feel like exercise  I lie down until the feeling passes.
author: Robert M. Hutchins

quote: I won't say I'm out of condition now -  but I even puff going downstairs.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: I get my exercise being a pallbearer for those of my friends who believed in regular running and calisthenics.
author: Anonymous

quote: Your medical tests are in. You're short  fat  and bald.
author: Tom Wilson

quote: The trouble with jogging is that  by the time you realize you're not in shape for it  it's too far to walk back.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: My husband wasn't listening when the doctor asked for "a urine  stool  and semen sample" . . . so I just told him they wanted his shorts.
author: Anonymous

quote: My doctor said I look like a million dollars -  green and wrinkled.
author: Red Skelton

quote: They say the Japanese don't experience menopause or hot flashes. If that's the case  why are they the number-one fan-producing country in the world?
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: doctor to stout patient: You've been swallowing your food again.
author: Anonymous

quote: Have you noticed when you go on a diet  the first thing you lose is your temper.
author: Robert Orben

quote: For fast-acting relief  try slowing down.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: I don't give my weight. I weigh a hundred and plenty.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: His idea of exercise is walking to his vitamins.
author: Casey Fenton

quote: Thank heaven  I have given up smoking again! . . . God! I feel fit. A different man. Irritable  moody  depressed  rude  perhaps . . . but the lungs are fine.
author: A. P. Herbert

quote: There must be something to acupuncture -  after all  you never see any sick porcupines.
author: Bob Goddard

quote: Condoms aren't completely safe. A friend of mine was wearing one . . . and got hit by a bus.
author: Bob Rubin

quote: I burned sixty calories. That should take care of a peanut I had in 1962.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: I never drink water because of the disgusting things that fish do in it.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: I'm Jewish. I don't work out. If God had wanted us to bend over  he would have put diamonds on the floor.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: I'm not that much into working out. My philosophy - no pain  no pain.
author: Toni Anderson

quote: My doctor gave me six months to live  but when I couldn't pay the bill  he gave me six months more.
author: Walter Mattbau

quote: Stressed spelled backwards is desserts.
author: Barbara Enberg

quote: Ladies and gentlemen  after what I've been through  I am happy just to be wearing clothes that open in the front.
author: David Letterman

quote: He who has health has hope  and he who has hope has everything.
author: Arabian proverb

quote: Refuse to be ill. Never tell people you are ill  never own it to yourself. Illess is one of those things which a man should resist on principle at the onset.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Health is not a condition of matter  but of Mind.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The first wealth is health.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Health lies in labor  and there is no royal road to it but through toil.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: The fate of a nation has often depended on the good or bad digestion of a prime minister.
author: Voltaire

quote: None so deaf as those that will not hear.
author: Matthew Henry

quote: Little pitchers have wide ears.
author: George Herbert

quote: Went in at the one ear and out at the other.
author: John Heywood

quote: He that hath ears to hear  let him hear.
author: Bible

quote: Where more is meant than meets the ear.
author: John Milton

quote: We have two ears and only one tongue in order that we may hear more and speak less.
author: Diogenes

quote: Friends  Romans  countrymen  lend me your ears.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Blessed are the pure in heart  for they shall see God.
author: Bible

quote: The tiny flame that lights up the human heart is like a blazing torch that comes down from heaven to light up the paths of mankind. For in one soul are contained the hopes and feelings of all Mankind.
author: Kahlil Gibran
